intro: Macaranga gamblei, commonly known as the Gambier tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The leaves are typically 10–20 cm in length and have a rough, hairy texture on the underside. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by distinctive yellow-orange fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in lowland rainforests.
